result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:30 PM  Defendant Joseph F Bender not in court.  Attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse in court for Joseph F Bender.  Prosecuting attorney Abbey Nickolie in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Sonderhouse requests his clients appearance be waived.  No objections. 
Court waives defendants appearance. 
Atty Sonderhouse requests an offer on the third case. 
State will have assigned ADA forward offer.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

8:45 AM Defendant Joseph F Bender in court, in custody.  Attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse in court for Joseph F Bender.  Prosecuting attorney Peter Michael Tempelis in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Sonderhouse has a few offer but not a consolidated offer on all matters and requests more time to speak to assigned ADA and get a consolidated offer on all matters. 
State does not object to a new date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle at all.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 4 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring through WCS.  CAM duration pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols.  Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM.  Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody.

03:03 PM Defendant Joseph F Bender in court, in custody, with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Sonderhouse appears as friend of the court.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel and have this matter tag along with the defendant's other matter.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
